Industrial Hearing Screening Tests

Early detection prevents irreversible hearing damage from workplace noise exposure.

What Is an Industrial Hearing Screening Test?

An industrial hearing screening test is a non-invasive assessment designed to check an employee's hearing levels, particularly in noisy work environments.

The test detects early noise-induced hearing loss before it becomes permanent, allowing preventative action to be taken.

Factories & manufacturing plantsConstruction sitesWarehouses & logistics centresAutomotive & engineering workshopsIndustrial plants & processing facilities

What Happens During the Test?

Our industrial hearing screening is quick, simple, and carried out on-site where possible to minimise disruption.

1

Pre-Test Questionnaire

Employees answer questions covering noise exposure, previous hearing issues, and protective equipment use.

2

Otoscopic Ear Check

A brief visual inspection of the ear canal to ensure no blockages or conditions affect results.

3

Audiometry Test

Employee wears headphones and indicates when they hear tones at different frequencies and volumes.

4

Results & Reporting

Immediate pass/refer outcome with clear explanation and employer summary report.

Each test takes 10–15 minutes per person

Who Should Have Hearing Screening?

Employees exposed to noise above 85 dB

New starters in noisy environments

Annual or periodic monitoring

Heavy machinery operators

Frequently Asked Questions

No. The test is completely painless and non-invasive. Employees simply wear headphones and indicate when they hear different tones.

Around 10–15 minutes per employee, depending on group size. We work efficiently to minimize disruption to your operations.

Employees should avoid loud noise exposure for several hours before the test where possible for the most accurate results.

A "refer" result does not mean permanent hearing loss. It indicates further assessment is recommended, usually through a full audiology evaluation.
